1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: v_adapter.c Fri 11-10-2000 9:52:36 pm HvA V1.00 $
3    | 
4    | Low level video adapter routines.
5    | ***************************************************************************/
6    | 
7    | #include <dos.h>
8    | #include <bios.h>
9    | #include <sys\movedata.h>
10   | #include "v_video.h"
11   | 
12   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
13   | 
14   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
15   | unsigned char getdosmembyte (int offset)
16   | {
17   |  unsigned char b=0;
18   | 
19   |   dosmemget (offset, sizeof(unsigned char), &b);
20   |   return b;
21   | }
22   | 
23   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
24   | 
25   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
26   | unsigned short getdosmemword (int offset)
27   | {
28   |   unsigned short w=0;
29   | 
30   |   dosmemget (offset, sizeof(unsigned short), &w);
31   |   return w;
32   | }
33   | 
34   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
35   | 
36   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
37   | void setdosmembyte (int offset, unsigned char b)
38   | {
39   |   dosmemput (&b, sizeof(unsigned char), offset);
40   | }
41   | 
42   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
43   | 
44   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
45   | void setdosmemword (int offset, unsigned short w)
46   | {
47   |   dosmemput (&w, sizeof(unsigned short), offset);
48   | }
49   | 
50   | 
51   | 
52   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
53   | v_query_adapter_type()  - Determine PC video adapter type
54   | This function returns a macro identifier indicating the adapter
55   | type.  See the list of adapter types in CURSPRIV.H.
56   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
57   | int v_query_adapter_type()
58   | {
59   |     int retval = _NONE;
60   |     union REGS regs;
61   | 
62   |         /* thanks to paganini@ax.apc.org for the GO32 fix */
63   | #  if defined(GO32) && defined(NOW_WORKS)
64   | #    include <dpmi.h>
65   |     _go32_dpmi_registers dpmi_regs;
66   | #  endif
67   |     int equip;
68   |     struct SREGS segs;
69   |     short video_base = getdosmemword (0x463);
70   | 
71   |     /*
72   |      * Attempt to call VGA Identify Adapter Function...
73   |      */
74   |     regs.h.ah = 0x1a;
75   |     regs.h.al = 0;
76   |     int86(0x10, &regs, &regs);
77   |     if ((regs.h.al == 0x1a) && (retval == _NONE))
78   |     {
79   |       /*
80   |        * We know that the PS/2 video BIOS is alive and well.
81   |        */
82   |       switch (regs.h.al)
83   |       {
84   |         case 0:
85   |             retval = _NONE;
86   |             break;
87   |         case 1:
88   |             retval = _MDA;
89   |             break;
90   |         case 2:
91   |             retval = _CGA;
92   |             break;
93   |         case 4:
94   |             retval = _EGACOLOR;
95   |             _cursvar.sizeable = TRUE;
96   |             break;
97   |         case 5:
98   |             retval = _EGAMONO;
99   |             break;
100  |         case 26:
101  |             retval = _VGACOLOR; /* ...alt. VGA BIOS... */
102  |         case 7:
103  |             retval = _VGACOLOR;
104  |             _cursvar.sizeable = TRUE;
105  |             break;
106  |         case 8:
107  |             retval = _VGAMONO;
108  |             break;
109  |         case 10:
110  |         case 13:
111  |             retval = _MCGACOLOR;
112  |             break;
113  |         case 12:
114  |             retval = _MCGAMONO;
115  |             break;
116  |         default:
117  |             retval = _CGA;
118  |             break;
119  |       }
120  | 
121  |     }
122  |     else
123  |     {
124  |       /*
125  |        * No VGA BIOS, check for an EGA BIOS by selecting an
126  |        * Alternate Function Service...
127  |        *
128  |        * bx == 0x0010  -->  return EGA information
129  |        */
130  |       regs.h.ah = 0x12;
131  |       regs.x.bx = 0x10;
132  |       int86(0x10, &regs, &regs);
133  |       if ((regs.h.bl != 0x10) && (retval == _NONE))
134  |       {
135  |           /*
136  |            * An EGA BIOS exists...
137  |            */
138  |           regs.h.ah = 0x12;
139  |           regs.h.bl = 0x10;
140  |           int86(0x10, &regs, &regs);
141  |           if (regs.h.bh == 0)
142  |               retval = _EGACOLOR;
143  |           else
144  |               retval = _EGAMONO;
145  |       }
146  |       else if (retval == _NONE)
147  |       {
148  |         /*
149  |          * Now we know we only have CGA or MDA...
150  |          */
151  |         int86(0x11, &regs, &regs);
152  |         equip = (regs.h.al & 0x30) >> 4;
153  |         switch (equip)
154  |         {
155  |         case 1:
156  |         case 2:
157  |             retval = _CGA;
158  |             break;
159  |         case 3:
160  |             retval = _MDA;
161  |             break;
162  |         default:
163  |             retval = _NONE;
164  |             break;
165  |         }
166  |       }
167  |     }
168  |     if (video_base == 0x3d4)
169  |     {
170  |       _cursvar.video_seg = 0xb800;
171  |       switch (retval)
172  |       {
173  |       case _EGAMONO:
174  |           retval = _EGACOLOR;
175  |           break;
176  |       case _VGAMONO:
177  |           retval = _VGACOLOR;
178  |           break;
179  |       default:
180  |           break;
181  |       }
182  |     }
183  |     if (video_base == 0x3b4)
184  |     {
185  |       _cursvar.video_seg = 0xb000;
186  |       switch (retval)
187  |       {
188  |       case _EGACOLOR:
189  |           retval = _EGAMONO;
190  |           break;
191  |       case _VGACOLOR:
192  |           retval = _VGAMONO;
193  |           break;
194  |       default:
195  |           break;
196  |       }
197  |     }
198  |     if ((retval == _NONE)
199  | #ifndef CGA_DIRECT
200  |     ||  (retval == _CGA)
201  | #endif
202  |     )
203  |     {
204  |         _cursvar.direct_video = FALSE;
205  |     }
206  |     if ((unsigned int) _cursvar.video_seg == 0xb000)
207  |         _cursvar.mono = TRUE;
208  |     else
209  |         _cursvar.mono = FALSE;
210  | 
211  |         /* Check for DESQview shadow buffer */
212  |         /* thanks to paganini@ax.apc.org for the GO32 fix */
213  | #if defined(GO32) && defined(NOW_WORKS)
214  |     dpmi_regs.h.ah = 0xfe;
215  |     dpmi_regs.h.al = 0;
216  |     dpmi_regs.x.di = _cursvar.video_ofs;
217  |     dpmi_regs.x.es = _cursvar.video_seg;
218  |     _go32_dpmi_simulate_int(0x10, &dpmi_regs);
219  |     _cursvar.video_ofs = dpmi_regs.x.di;
220  |     _cursvar.video_seg = dpmi_regs.x.es;
221  | #endif
222  | 
223  | #if !defined(GO32) && !defined(WATCOMC)
224  |     regs.h.ah = 0xfe;
225  |     regs.h.al = 0;
226  |     regs.x.di = _cursvar.video_ofs;
227  |     segs.es   = _cursvar.video_seg;
228  |     int86x(0x10, &regs, &regs, &segs);
229  |     _cursvar.video_ofs = regs.x.di;
230  |     _cursvar.video_seg = segs.es;
231  | #endif
232  | 
233  |     if  (!_cursvar.adapter)
234  |         _cursvar.adapter = retval;
235  |     return (v_sanity_check(retval));
236  | }
237  | 
238  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
239  | v_sanity_check() - A video adapter identification sanity check.
240  | This routine will force sane values for various control flags.
241  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
242  | int v_sanity_check(int adapter)
243  | {
244  |     int fontsize = v_get_font();
245  |     int rows     = v_get_rows();
246  | 
247  |     switch (adapter)
248  |     {
249  |     case _EGACOLOR:
250  |     case _EGAMONO:
251  |         switch (rows)
252  |         {
253  |         case 25:    break;
254  |         case 43:    break;
255  |         default:
256  |             _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
257  |             break;
258  |         }
259  | 
260  |         switch (fontsize)
261  |         {
262  |         case _FONT8:    break;
263  |         case _FONT14:   break;
264  |         default:
265  |             _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
266  |             break;
267  |         }
268  |         break;
269  | 
270  |     case _VGACOLOR:
271  |     case _VGAMONO:
272  | 
273  | /*                                                                  */
274  | /* lets be reasonably flexible with VGAs - they could be Super VGAs */
275  | /* capable of displaying any number of lines. MH 10-Jun-92          */
276  | /* This also applies to font size.            MH 16-Jun-92          */
277  | /*
278  |         switch (rows)
279  |         {
280  |         case 25:    break;
281  |         case 43:    break;
282  |         case 50:    break;
283  |         default:
284  |             _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
285  |             break;
286  |         }
287  | 
288  |         switch (fontsize)
289  |         {
290  |         case _FONT8:    break;
291  |         case _FONT14:   break;
292  |         case _FONT16:   break;
293  |         default:
294  |             _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
295  |             break;
296  |         }
297  | */
298  |         break;
299  | 
300  |     case _CGA:
301  |     case _MDA:
302  |     case _MCGACOLOR:
303  |     case _MCGAMONO:
304  |         switch (rows)
305  |         {
306  |         case 25:    break;
307  |         default:
308  |             _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
309  |             break;
310  |         }
311  |         break;
312  | 
313  |     default:
314  |         _cursvar.bogus_adapter = TRUE;
315  |         break;
316  |     }
317  |     if (_cursvar.bogus_adapter)
318  |     {
319  |         _cursvar.sizeable   = FALSE;
320  |         _cursvar.direct_video   = FALSE;
321  |     }
322  |     return (adapter);
323  | }
324  |
